description.narrative: The project envisages that residents of pilot rural areas in Khatlon region and Rasht valley are equipped with skills for employment, self-employment and innovations in farming and agribusiness spheres

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1.1.1 - 1 needs assessment of local stakeholders in provision of service delivery at the local level 1.1.2 - 4 mobile applications developed to ease service delivery, particularly on education, health, access to legal aid, etc. 1.1.3 - 2 district development programmes (DDP) adopted 1.1.4.1 - 8 public hearings on local development issues for local stakeholders conducted 1.1.4.2 - 300 (including 108 women) people attended public hearings on local development issues for local stakeholders 1.1.5 - 2 local development forums conducted to improve attractiveness of rural area 1.1.6 - 10 awareness raising campaigns conducted on improving service delivery 1.1.7 - 2 exchange visits to local level policy makers organized to Russian Federation engaged on services delivery 1.1.8 - 2 services to entrepreneurs improved supporting investment climate at the pilot rural areas 1.2.1.1 - 3 capacity building activities conducted to FEZ staff on promotion, marketing and management of FEZ 1.2.1.2 - 115 (47 women) people attended in the capacity building activities to FEZ staff on promotion, marketing and management of FEZ 1.2.2 - 2 B2B and G2B meetings organized with participation of state authorities, entrepreneurship, investors and other interested parties, particularly representatives from Russian Federation and CIS countries 1.2.3.1. improved of technical capacity of FEZ through provision of equipment and furniture 1.2.3.2 - comment.narrative: 1.1.1 - 1 needs assessment of local stakeholders in provision of service delivery at the local level 1.1.3 - 2 district development programmes (DDP) adopted 1.1.5 - 1 local development forum conducted to improve attractiveness of rural area 1.1.6 - 3 awareness raising campaigns conducted on improving service delivery 1.2.1.1 - 1 capacity building activities conducted to FEZ staff on promotion, marketing and management of FEZ 1.2.1.2 - 35 (15 women) people attended in the capacity building activities to FEZ staff on promotion, marketing and management of FEZ 1.2.3.2 - 2 informational materials developed on FEZ activities and their dissemination among interested parties 1.2.4 - 2 new enterprises registered in FEZ Kulob 2.1.2 - 40 (at least 30% women led farms) farmers received services and maintain new farming technologies 2.2.1 - 5 (at least 2 women led) dehkan farms, entrepreneurs and youth benefited from business acceleration and incubation programs 2.2.2 - 5 (at least 2 women) projects presented in demo days among investors 2.2.3.1 - 9 (at least 3 women led) provided with credit funds for launching small economic projects 2.2.3.2 - 20 (at least 9 for women) job created for men and youth 2.2.4 - 1 supported value chains for production and processing of green products 2.2.6 - 2 best practices and success stories developed and disseminated among 5000 people
